rules.title: Objective
rules.description: The objective of the game is to capture all of your opponent's pieces or block them so they cannot move.

rules.title: Starting Position
rules.description: Each player begins with 12 pieces placed on the dark squares of the first three rows closest to them on an 8x8 board.

rules.title: Movement
rules.description: Pieces can only move diagonally forward to an adjacent dark square that is not occupied.

rules.title: Capturing
rules.description: If an opponent's piece is adjacent to yours and there is an empty square directly behind it, you must jump over the opponent's piece and capture it.

rules.title: King Pieces
rules.description: When a piece reaches the opponent's back row, it becomes a King. Kings can move and capture diagonally both forward and backward.

rules.title: Winning the Game
rules.description: The game ends when one player captures all of the opponent's pieces or blocks all their moves.

rules.title: Forced Captures
rules.description: If a player can make a capture, they are required to do so. If multiple captures are available, the player can choose which to execute.

rules.title: Double Jumps
rules.description: If, after capturing a piece, the same piece can make another capture, the player must continue jumping with that piece until no more captures are possible.

rules.title: Draws
rules.description: If neither player can force a win, the game is declared a draw.

additional_notes: Checkers is also known as Draughts in some countries.
The official rules may vary slightly depending on the version or organization.
